channel.title: Help please!
channel.description:
ok i tried the code from the compile help thing didnt work well im using berky-scape and when i try to compile it says can not find specific path or something like that and this is the compile code
[code]@echo off Title Berky-Scape Compiler cd .. "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\Bulby\io\packets\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bulby/ ./io/./packets/*.java pause[/code]
please help me

item.title: Help please!
item.dc:creator: @Gold_Light Gold Light
item.description:
@Gold_Light wrote:

k then stop posting random crap and tell me what you mean.

Read full topic

item.title: Help please!
item.dc:creator: @powerknite7 powerknite7
item.description:
@powerknite7 wrote:

[quote=“Gold Light, post:7, topic:274105”]Explain how that makes no sense… would you like me to put comma’s for you?

“It doesn’t matter what the code says, its old so change it, Newest JDK is 1.6.0_13.”

happy now?[/quote]

omg … u even dont know what i mean ,…

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Help please!
item.dc:creator: @adamhelloman8 adamhelloman8
item.description:
@adamhelloman8 wrote:

It’s not that it doesnt work, you have to set it to you’re current jdk version.

[quote=“scoobygod, post:1, topic:274105”]@echo off Title Berky-Scape Compiler cd .. "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\Bulby\io\packets\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bulby/ ./io/./packets/*.java pause[/quote]

You have to change the jdk1.6.0_07

For example, here’s what mine would look like, since i have jdk 6 update 12.

@echo off Title Berky-Scape Compiler cd .. "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\Bulby\io\packets\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bulby/ ./io/./packets/*.java pause

Read full topic
